intro: Gomidesia eriocalyx var. acuminata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gomidesia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes plants such as cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in dense undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
